topic.title: Coffeeholics Café and Bakery
topic.shortdesc: This topic is about a coffee shop in Downtown Blacksburg named Coffeeholics.

fig.title: The exterior of Coffeeholics Café and Bakery.

image.alt: A picture of the outside of Coffeeholics which features a sign and windows displaying menu items, as well as a giant purple and green owl mural stretching across the entirety of the exterior.

section.title: Location
section.p: 211 Draper Rd NW Suite A, Blacksburg, VA 24060
There is a big mural that makes it hard to miss and cute signage.

section.title: Atmosphere

image.alt: A picture of the interior of Coffeeholics displaying a side view of the register with the bakery items and most of the tables that are all across the shop.

section.p: There is plenty of seating and fun wall decor. The shop also has a section in the back with couches and artwork. It has large windows for natural lighting as well as small lights that are not too harsh.

section.title: Cost
section.p: Fairly average, slightly on the lower side.

section.title: Chai Rating
section.p: Spices are well done and it was overall delicious. It came out warm but not too hot as to burn one's mouth.

section.title: Food
section.p: The shop offers a wide selection of pastries and sandwiches. If dining-in, they will be presented on plates to limit waste. They also offer boba, although it is not very good.

section.title: Overall Rating
section.p: Coffeeholics was my favorite place to visit. The food and drinks are delicious and fairly priced. The environment was the best to be in with a multitude of places to sit and types of places to sit. They offer a wide variety of options and I believe most anyone can find something to enjoy in there.
